questions.questionContent: Which of the following statements about intelligence is correct?
questions.optionA: Intelligence is a fixed ability determined at the time of birth only
questions.optionB: Intelligence can be accurately measured and determined by using standardized tests.
questions.optionC: Intelligence is a unitary factor and a single trait.
questions.optionD: Intelligence is multi-dimensional and a set of complex abilities.

questions.questionContent: In a situation of less participation of students belonging to a deprived group in the teaching learning process, what teacher should do?
questions.optionA: Ask the children to withdraw from school
questions.optionB: Accept this situation as it is.
questions.optionC: Lower her expectations from such students.
questions.optionD: Reflect on her own teaching and find ways to improve student's involvement.

questions.questionContent: In the constructivist framework, Learning is primarily
questions.optionD: Focused on the process of meaning making.

questions.optionD: Labelling and categorization of Students base on ability.

questions.questionContent: How can teachers facilitate understanding of complex concepts in Children?
questions.optionD: By providing opportunities for exploration and discussion

questions.questionContent: EVS for classes-III to V is a subject area which integrates
questions.optionA: The concepts and issues of Science.

questions.questionContent: Which of the following is the main purpose of inclusive education?
questions.optionA: To provide equal opportunities to all students regardless of their physical abilities

questions.optionC: To create a competitive environment among students
questions.optionD: To ensure higher grades for all students

questions.questionContent: Which educational philosophy emphasizes 'learning by doing'?

questions.optionB: The method and practice of teaching
